title: Bank stocks swing to gains after jobs data
text: Financial stocks pulled a sharp U-turn in premarket trading Friday, swinging to broad gains from broad losses, after the government's September jobs report, which showed new hiring was less than expected but the unemployment surprisingly fell. The SPDR Financial Select Sector ETF XLF, +0.41% rose 0.3% ahead of the open, after being down 0.4% just before the jobs data. Among the sector tracker's more-active components, shares of Bank of America Corp. BAC, -0.11% rose 0.3%, compared with a pre-data loss of 0.3%; Citigroup Inc. C, +0.66% swung to a gain of 0.3% from a decline of 0.1% and J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. JPM, -0.14% rose 0.2%, reversing a pre-data loss of 0.3%. Wells Fargo & Co.'s WFC, +0.02% was little changed, erasing an earlier loss of 0.1%. Meanwhile, futures YMZ19, +0.21% for the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.47% rose 33 points, versus a per-data decline of 78 points.
